intro: Melampyrum caerulescens, commonly known as blue flame or blue betony, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, which includes many parasitic and semi-parasitic species. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges. Its flowers are small, clustered in spikes, and range in color from blue to purple. Melampyrum caerulescens is known for its medicinal uses in traditional herbal medicine.
